titles.title: Miwaleta Park Expansion Act
Miwaleta Park Expansion Act
Miwaleta Park Expansion Act
To provide for the conveyance by the Bureau of Land Management to Douglas County, Oregon, of a county park and certain adjacent land.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Resources.
Referred to the Subcommittee on National Parks and Public Lands.
Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee by Voice Vote.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.

action.text: Reported by the Committee on Resources. H. Rept. 106-446.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 256.

action.text: Mr. Hansen moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 1725.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

calendar.text: Read twice. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 470.

action.text: Measure laid before Senate by unanimous consent.

vote.text: Passed Senate with an amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Mr. Gibbons moved that the House suspend the rules and agree to the Senate amendments.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on the motion.

vote.text: On motion that the House suspend the rules and agree to the Senate amendments Agreed to by voice vote.

reference.label: text as House agreed to Senate amendments

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 10/5/2000--Passed Senate amended. Miwaleta Park Expansion Act - Directs the Secretary of the Interior to convey to Douglas County, Oregon, without consideration, Miwaleta Park and an adjacent tract of Bureau of Land Management land for use for public park purposes consistent with the plan for the expansion of the Park.
